lead_paragraph: Billy Taylor, who led Lehigh’s men’s basketball team to the N.C.A.A. tournament in 2004, was hired by Ball State yesterday. He replaces Ronny Thompson, who resigned last month amid accusations that he broke N.C.A.A. rules and his claims that he faced a hostile racial environment. Ball State was 9-22 in Thompson’s only season as head coach and faces questions from the N.C.A.A., including an allegation that university officials fired the women’s volleyball coach for reporting suspected infractions by Thompson and his staff.
